frame.name: Emptying
frame.definition:
<def-root>These are words relating to emptying containers and clearing areas of some substance or items. The area or container can appear as the direct object with all these verbs, and is designated <fen>Source</fen> because it is the source of motion of the <fen>Theme</fen>. Corresponding to its nuclear argument status, it is also affected in some crucial way, unlike <fen>Source</fen> in other frames. Some words in this frame, such as <ment>empty</ment>, may also occur with <fen>Path</fen> or <fen>Goal</fen> expressions, e.g.
<ex><fex name="Agent">The players</fex> <t>emptied</t> <fex name="Source">the bucket</fex> <fex name="Path">over his head</fex>. </ex></def-root>

FE.name: Agent
FE.definition: <def-root>The <fen>Agent</fen> is the entity that does the emptying. <ex><fex name="Agent">Pat</fex> <t>cleared</t> the table of dishes.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Theme
FE.definition: <def-root>The <fen>Theme</fen>, when overtly expressed, invariably occurs in a PP Complement headed by "of". <ex>Pat <t>cleared</t> the table <fex name="Thm">of dishes</fex>.</ex> </def-root>

FE.name: Source
FE.definition: <def-root>The <fen>Source</fen> is the region or container which is emptied of something. In this frame, the <fen>Source</fen> occurs as an NP Object. <ex>Pat <t>cleared</t> <fex name="Src">the table</fex>.</ex> </def-root>

FE.name: Path
FE.definition: <def-root>The <fen>Path</fen> is any description of a trajectory of motion which is neither a <fen>Source</fen> nor a <fen>Goal</fen>. <ex>Kim <t>emptied</t> the basin <fex name="Path">over the edge of the balcony</fex>.</ex> </def-root>

FE.name: Goal
FE.definition: <def-root>The <fen>Goal</fen> is any expression which tells where the <fen>Theme</fen> ends up, or would end up, as a result of the motion. <ex>The children <t>emptied</t> the toy box <fex name="Goal">onto the floor</fex>.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Depictive
FE.definition: <def-root>Depicitive phrase describing either the <fen>Agent</fen> or <fen>Theme</fen> of the emptying. <ex><fex name="Dep">Naked</fex>, <fex name="Agent">Millhouse</fex> <t>emptied</t> <fex name="Source">the trash can</fex>.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Instrument
FE.definition: <def-root>This is the object with which the <fen>Agent</fen> empties the <fen>Source</fen>. <ex>I <t>emptied</t> the tub <fex name="Inst">with a bucket</fex>.</ex> <ex>I <t>peeled</t> the oranges <fex name="Inst">with a knife</fex>.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Cause
FE.definition: <def-root>The <fen>Cause</fen> is the non-sentient force which instigates the emptying. <ex><fex name="Cause">A basic washing</fex> can <t>degrease</t> <fex name="Source">your workclothes</fex>.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Place
FE.definition:
<def-root>The location where the emptying takes place.
<ex>Don't <t>eviscerate</t> him <fex name="pla">in the house</fex>!</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Time
FE.definition:
<def-root>The time at which the emptying takes place.
<ex>The prisoners were <t>deloused</t> <fex name="tim">in June and August</fex>.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Containing_event
FE.definition: <def-root>This FE denotes an event that occurs or state of affairs that holds at a time that includes the time during which the event or state of affairs reported by the target occurs and of which it is taken to be a part.</def-root>

FE.name: Explanation
FE.definition: <def-root>The Explanation denotes a proposition from which the main clause (headed by the target) logically follows. This often means that the Explanation causes the target's proposition, but not in all cases. </def-root>

FE.name: Circumstances
FE.definition: <def-root>Circumstances describe the state of the world (at a particular time and place) which is specifically independent of the event itself and any of its participants. </def-root>

FE.name: Purpose
FE.definition: <def-root>The reason why the <fen>Agent</fen> empties the <fen>Source</fen> of the <fen>Theme</fen>. </def-root>

lexUnit.name: ontbossen.v
lexUnit.definition: het bos in het genoemde gebied omhakken
